result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dvarion Montrell Beamon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dvarion Montrell Beamon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Dvarion Montrell Beamon.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status conference. Attorney Fuentes has recently been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dvarion Montrell Beamon not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch PE.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dvarion Montrell Beamon not in court, in custody in Racine Correctional.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant unable to be produced from Racine. And SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling. Defendant at Racine Correctional.

Defendant Dvarion Montrell Beamon appeared by video, in custody at Racine Correctional Institution.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Dvarion Montrell Beamon.  Attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
